name: Vegan Chickpea Curry without Coconut Milk
author: ssuthers
summary: This recipe was given to me by my boss, who is Asian. It has been passed through generations of her family so as you can imagine it is the real deal. Very healthy and super tasty. You can serve it as a side or main. Serve with either rice, bread, bhaji, or samosas.
ingredients: 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
directions: Drain and rinse chickpeas under cold running water
Place in a bowl, cover with cold water, and stir in baking soda
Heat oil in a pot and cook onion until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes
Stir in garlic-ginger paste, cayenne, salt, turmeric, and garam masala
Cook and stir until spices are well absorbed by the onion, about 2 minutes
Add tomatoes and frozen spinach; stir to combine
Simmer until flavors are well combined, about 20 minutes
Add a little water if sauce is too thick
